analyzed: yang gal te dgon pa dang / bas mtha' dang / yul mi med pa dang / @339a *// nags 'dabs dang / ri'i phug dang / dur khrod dang / sog ma'i phung po la sogs pa'i gnas mal sna tshogs na gnas pa las /

analyzed: rang sangs rgyas dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa dag gis dben par gyur na /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dben par gnas pa yin no; ;de grong gi nang na gnas kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / thabs mkhas pa dang / sems can thams cad la byams pa dang / snying rje chen po'i gnas pas gnas te /
translated: Even if they live in a village, they live by means of the transcendent perfection of wisdom, skillful means, love for all sentient beings, and great compassion.

analyzed: gnas pa 'dis gnas pa de ni /

analyzed: gal te byang chub sems @339b dpa' sems dpa' chen po dgon pa dang / nags 'dabs dang / ri'i phug dang / dur khrod dang / bas mtha'i gnas mal dag na gnas pa 'dis gnas na /
translated: If the bodhisattva great beings, abiding in this seclusion, spend the day and night in a forest, a grove, a mountain, a cave, a charnel ground, or a remote dwelling,

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dben par gnas pa yin no //

original: rab 'byor / gang yang bdud sdig can gyis dgon pa dang / nags 'dabs dang / ri'i phug dang / dur khrod dang / bas mtha'i gnas mal du gnas pa'i dben pa nye bar bstan pa'i dben pa des de nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa dag dang 'dres pa nyid du gyur pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mngon par mi brtson
analyzed: rab 'byor / gang yang bdud sdig can gyis dgon pa dang / nags 'dabs dang / ri'i phug dang / dur khrod dang / bas mtha'i gnas mal du gnas pa'i dben pa nye bar bstan pa'i dben pa des de nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa dag dang 'dres pa nyid du gyur pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mngon par mi brtson
translated: “Subhūti, the evil Māra, in order to cause bodhisattva great beings to be separated from the perfection of wisdom, will teach them the solitude of living in a forest, a jungle, a mountain cave, a charnel ground, or a remote place.

original: zhing thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yongs su rdzogs par mi byed de /
analyzed: zhing thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes yongs su rdzogs par mi byed de /

original: de ltar 'dres par gnas pas gnas shing /

original: lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las kyi mtha' yongs su ma dag pas na /
analyzed: lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las kyi mtha' yongs su ma dag pas na /

analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa dag gis dben par gyur pa /

analyzed: rab 'byor / gang yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'brog dgon pa dpag tshad brgya pa / gcan gzan dang / ri dvags dang / bya'i tshogs med pa /

analyzed: chom rkun med pa'i dgon pa 'jigs pa mi bzad pa dang / 'tshe ba med pa dag na lo'am /

analyzed: rab 'byor / gnas pa gang gis bdag gnas pa 'di dag ni /
translated: Subhūti, those who think, ‘I am living in this way

original: gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: gnas pa yin te /
translated: because of the way I am living,

original: bdag ni / mi ma yin pa dag gis bskul cing /
analyzed: bdag ni / mi ma yin pa dag gis bskul cing /

analyzed: grong gi nang na gnas pa su zhig la mi ma yin pa dag skul par byed /

analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ni /
